title: Web Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions:
1) Email acknowledging---with somewhat vague and very dry language---that you "are to be considered" by the department for the position you applied and will be contacted.
2) Five part in-person interview that lasts a total of three and a half hours:
  a) Half-hour with your would-be supervisor.
  b) Half-hour with HR.
  c) Half-hour with admin person, or the departmental head.
  d) An hour with panel that consists of the entire IT department that was present that day---in my case 20+ people.
  e) One hour with the search committee.

This process can be daunting but it gives you plenty of time to get to know who you will be working with and find out as much information as possible. The critical part is the meeting with the search committee where they give you a couple of technical questions.

3) If they decide to higher you, you will first be contacted by the person in the unit designated for hiring, which may be someone that you have not met or been in contact with at all. They will set a time to talk with you. This is when they will ask you if you are interested still and where the negotiation process starts---be prepared.
4) They will send you and offer letter stating the terms discussed and a deadline to accept or decline.
5) If you accept the offer will be contingent on you passing a background check and potentially other test(s) depending on the position. For this position only the background check was necessary.
Interview Questions:
- What will show up on the browser for this HTML/CSS/JS code?
-How would you fetch an external JSON API? What library would you use?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL)
Interview Descriptions:
It took 2 months for me to get an interview. The interview process and questions were easy. This is good and bad. It's good if you're not good at interviews, but know what you're doing. Then for a tech position, it should be easy to answer the questions, which they seem to care about more than the behavioral ones. It's bad because they could end up hiring someone incompetent.

You interview with a committee. Typically, a third of the members will know specifics about your position. The rest will be from other departments/positions on campus. Usually after the position closes, they will review all applications and decide to interview the top 3-5 candidates. The committee has a list of pre-defined questions that they'll ask every candidate.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? What is one advantage and one disadvantage for using tables in HTML?

Interview Questions: They liked to ask what their Center could be doing better from the outsider's/applicant's perspective.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: After a chat on Skype I was invited for a talk and get the offer two days later, pretty smooth process. The perspective advisor showed me the lab and we talk about my experience and how that could be a valuable addiction to the group and to the department
Interview Questions: I was asked to show the projects I was working on

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: Illinois follows the standard academic process: First, there is an initial interview, usually at meetings. Second, there is a campus visit with a seminar and appointments with faculty. You also meet graduate students. Candidates are asked about their current research and future plans, as well as about their teaching interests.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straightforward.  After applying for job online (jobs.illinos.edu), the search committee invites for you for an interview.  The committee consists of selected 4-6 faculty from within that department as well as an HR representative. You will be asked to present a mini lecture generally on a topic related to the courses they are hiring for.  The search committee members all have behavioral questions prepared mainly to assess your personality and how you will fit in with the department.   The search committee is generally composed of random faculty who may not even specialize in they area they are hiring for.  The key advice is to be amicable and professional.  It would be a good idea to search online for the typical questions they ask for teaching positions.  Practice your mock lecture.  If you are truly passionate about teaching and have plans to change things, be careful on how much you share during the interview as this my rub some folks (especially if they are not as passionate about teaching) the wrong way.  Overall, realize that  even if you are hired it is highly likely that you will not interact with any of the committee members  so make sure to put your best foot forward and avoid anything controversial.  Make sure you contemplate about your teaching philosophy.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching philosophy?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: After applying via email I was contacted a few days later to come in for an in person interview. It was very casual and done by about 2-3 people who worked in the office. They mostly asked about my experience and availability.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with Microsoft Office?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is simple and easy, just get through your resume and let you share your previous experiences listed in your resume. Getting more details about the project from the interviewer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL)
Interview Descriptions: This was a typical Panel interview. Search Committee were from different department. They did a good job to break the ice and questioned on communication and programming skills, data base experience.
Interview Questions:
What’s your recent job? What do you do in recent job?
Do you know parallel computing?

title: International Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was relatively straightforward. Someone called me to set up the interview, which they said would be a phone interview. Although I asked about the format, they were extremely vague and never mentioned who would be interviewing me (although I probably should have asked). I guessed this would be a screening of sorts, so I wasn't too worried about it. I was very wrong, as it ended up being a full interview panel of 5 people interviewing me. This completely threw me off, as at that point I'd never had any interview by phone that wasn't a casual get-to-know-you. As such, I was so flustered that even though I was a good candidate for the job, the interview went south very quickly as I was unable to recover from the shock that I had an entire panel of 5 people interviewing me without warning...via phone. Live and learn!
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have working with international students?

title: Technical Support Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: All via email. Although I was informed via email that I was a candidate, I was never contacted for an in-person interview. It's as if they already knew who they wanted to hire, but had to follow Civil Service procedures as a formality. It was a very disappointing process. Seems like a case of who you know versus what you know.
Interview Questions: They asked me to name some key networking components.

title: Business Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview, took over an hour, and then found out they had a 'preferred candidate' and already knew who they were going to hire, but had to interview at least 3 people to satisfy diversity requirement, waste of my time.
Interview Questions: basic questions about the job and my experience, nothing unusual

title: Network Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Student position - one email and one interview. A handful of technical questions. Received email for an interview and an offer was followed up a couple days later.  Quick and easy experience.
Interview Questions: How many passwords do students have?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview with RD or one of main coordinators, overall made you feel very comfortable, about 20 minutes and asked a lot about diversity and time management and why I want the RA position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an RA?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with one person. Discussed generic interview questions and my availability which seemed like a big factor as they need people to fill certain time slots. Seem willing to take anyone who is willing to learn and be professional.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with time management?

title: AITS Technical Service Provider Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: fairly simple. They looked to gauge workplace fit as opposed to technical questions. They mainly looked to see how one handles difficult customers as a majority of the customers are aggravated or need to be walked slowly through computing processes.
Interview Questions: How many years of customer service experience

title: Research Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone call you and talk about the research you like, and talk about which professors you feel interested if you get enrolled in UIUC. They will also ask your GPA and GRE scores in the interview. You need to tell them your major GPA and total GPA.
Interview Questions: How many project have you worked

title: Structural Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: Search the details about it. Send email to see whether you can discuss it. See the person and talk with confidence. After that go to your job. Try to work hard and get well with workmates.
Interview Questions: For me is language problem

title: IT Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Had a friend that recommended me and was contacted through e-mail. The process was super quick and the interview was really good! They do have a test to see if you know how to do basic things like ping IP addresses and install basic anti-virus. You can prepare for that ahead of time though and it's really simple to do in the interview.
Interview Questions: How would you handle x customer request

title: Housing Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was refereed to the director by a friend, sent my resume and a cover letter. Was quickly scheduled for a one on one interview with the director. (Usually the interview is with the program manager, but in my case the program manager was on a leave so I was interviewed by the director instead.) The interview was rescheduled once on the day of because it was towards fall break and the office was especially busy.
Interview Questions:
Questions about repair scenario (answers can be found on the Tenant Union website)
Past experiences
Questions about communications skills, conflict resolution

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: Talking with professors about my program skills and telling whether or not I could be able to attend multiple slots to hold office hours and discussion sections. Also, I need to demonstrate my strong assembly language debuging skills since this job requires me to fix bugs for lc3 assembly code for students with different background. It also asks me to show strong C program skills.
Interview Questions: Debuging assembly code is hard.

title: Illinois Consulting Group Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: Case Interview. I was given a random case, and I had to analyze it as detailedly as possible. It was quite challenging for candidates without previous experience because it requires intuition of market and tight logic.
Interview Questions: Case Analysis

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: I work at the Campus University Libraries and the hiring and interview process was great! I submitted my application on the online UIUC library website, filled out the questions, and chose my library preferences.  I then went into each of the libraries with my resume and availability and asked if there positions available for the upcoming semester. I then got a response quickly and was basically hired on the spot with minimal interview questions.  I would say the best way to get this job is by being persistent and asking at the right time.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions.  They didn't really ask anything off my resume at all.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Essentially, get in contact with a professor of choice, and talk about your interests and if there is funding available for a project of interest. If the professor is willing to take you on as a graduate student, take the required tests (don't need a specific score for some departments at the university) and wait to hear if they accept you. Usually know about rejection/acceptance around February or March.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in graduate school?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: The first step in the hiring process is to apply for jobs and to get your application into contention for the jobs you are interested in. Once you have a applied, applicant tracking systems are used by many employers to process job applications and to manage the hiring process. Interview process starts with screening interviews, followed by in-person interviews, second interviews and even third interviews.
Interview Questions: In a way that anyone could understand, can you describe a professional achievement that you are proud of?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen for 15 minutes, then onsite interview - meet with 5-6 ppl individually, and then a presentation like a business case.  Look for culture fit and ppl with good thought process.
Interview Questions: make a presentation on a given topic

title: Illini Union Marketing Student Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was great. Super friendly group of interviewers. It was everyone from the office basically. I just showed them my portfolio, they asked a few questions about my projects and that was it.
Interview Questions: Explain your design process. What is the first thing you do when you start a project?

title: Front Desk Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was referred here from a friend of the housing representative.When she heard about my exceptional skills and personality she wrote me an email telling me to come in with my ID and social security number to fill out some papers.
Interview Questions: Past job experience

title: Research Programmer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: This was an internally created position and the requirements were written so I was to be the most likely candidate for the job.  I had one interview by my current supervisor. The position had to be publicly advertised so now you know how some things work in the world of academia.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Is very useful to know someone who can introduce you to the individual library's managing librarian. After that, I was introduced to my immediate boss, who managed the students working in the library.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was not interview process- you were assigned a position. You met with the graduate supervisor and they gave you a teaching assitantship based on what classes or work needed to be taught/completed. If you wanted to teach a certain class you would have to meet with the professor who oversaw the class and lobby to teach that section. Getting a teaching assistantship can be very political at the University of Illinois. I got the job and found the experience of the interview to be somewhat frustrating as you could not control which teaching asisstantship you would have.
Interview Questions: Generally if any questions were asked it was about how you related to the course material

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Getting a TA job doesn't require an interview - just filling out forms for each department you want a TA job in that says your skills, classes you're willing to TA, classes you're not willing to TA, etc. Then it just comes down to whether the department in question will offer you a position - they tend to give it to people in that department first, then turn to outsiders.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Grad Student Dining Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Just mail the concerned employee after looking it up online on their website. And then, attend their workshop. Once you are sure you want to work for them, talk to their manager.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Dining services?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: Apply through University admission website. Requires a moderate to high GRE. A good GPA is also required along with 100+ TOEFL score. Publication records are always adding extra value.
Interview Questions: Getting high GRE and GPA.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: Phone/skype interviews...will ask about your past experiences and research
Interview Questions: How will be your research different from master's?

title: Community Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Online short answer questions, they are pretty broad and seem to overlap with each other. When I applied there was another round of questions sent out and they requested a sample of previous work as well. Then there is an person interview with the supervisor and then I met the other liaisons who were working at that time. After you get the job you have to go to a meeting where you meet all of the new and old members of the office.
Interview Questions: Strengths and Weaknesses

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process depends on the department and individual principal investigator (if you seek a position as a research assistant or lab manager). The best way to prepare is to have shared interests and a meaningful understanding of the material that the lab studies.  I recommend applying to labs only if you share research interests with the lab.
Interview Questions: No interview questions were asked -- I was hired immediately after completing my undergraduate degree by my thesis advisor.

title: Associate Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I appreciate the search committee style of interview. It allows more people to assist with the decision making process and probably makes it more fair and balanced. I sometimes wonder if the people who are asking questions from the committee really know and understand the job. It might be difficult to hire for a position you really are not familiar with and it might make it hard to match the right candidate with the job. It was disappointing that I was asked to put together a presentation for an interview and spent several hours on the presentation to not get the position because I was overqualified.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness.

title: Dining Hall Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: They sit everyone down in a room and show you a video and presentation of what you're expected to do. Pretty boring to be honest but you do what you've got to do. After that you give them all your documents (birth certificate, SS card, passport if needed) and then you're basically in a mob of students going for what shifts you want. Then boom you're hired.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: it is guranteed, teaching assisstantship does not require special interview
Interview Questions: none

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and laid back
Interview Questions: Why are you applying to this job above any other

title: Research Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with a search committee of 5 people, who ended up being my coworkers, plus one member of HR.  They had a long list of pre-prepared questions that they asked every applicant. Though this is a technical position, there weren't any technical questions that required problem-solving. They were questions about my skills, and then about my resume. I mentioned that I had a portfolio to share, which I sent them after the interview. This was not required, however.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were of the format: Do you have experience with X? Tell us about it.

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: In my case, the interview was pretty easy. Just emailed to say I was interested in TAing the class after I received my final grade for the class. He then emailed all the qualified students saying that he was looking to hire TAs. I responded to this email, and he scheduled a time to meet with me and simply chat about my experience in his class. If you are really passionate about the material, the interview is no problem.
Interview Questions: The interview was a simple chat, so there was no tricky question. Just be honest and explain why you care about the position/why you think you can succeed with the job.

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward, via email, just asked why I think I deserved the job. Got a response within a few days, saying that the position was mine if I wanted it
Interview Questions: If I had taken the class and why did I think I should get the job

title: Research Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: Applied online; Face to face interview; Recommendation Letters
Interview Questions: Questions relevant to the position; past research experiences; familiarity with various programming Languages and other technologies; also few research questions relevant to the group I have applied.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: Email correspondence back and forth for a few rounds, then got a phone interview. Asked about my previous experiences, especially whether I had publications. Nothing unexpected. After the first phone interview, got another one or two talk over phone.
Interview Questions: Will you accept the offer if I give it to you?

title: Microbiology Preparatory Lab Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had to submit my resume to the supervisor (who is also a course coordinator) and they would look over it with the lab manager (a student) and the student interviewed me, which made it less intimidating because they had been through the same process as me not too long ago.
Interview Questions: They asked about what classes I had taken, if I could do some basic stoichiometry and dilution math, how I had heard about the opportunity, and how I worked in teams.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: Took about 1 week after I applied to hear back and another to be hired
Interview Questions: Random calculation questions, like determining volume of solvent to create a certain concentration

title: Illinois Student Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The process was pretty straightforward and involved two main parts.  One part was one-on-one with an admissions counsellor to go over the basic interview and screening questions and to start to get to know your personality.  This is then either preceded or followed by a group interview where you have to respond to hard-hitting questions about the university that reflect common problems on campus or worries from moms.
Interview Questions: What is unofficial?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: application to graduate college so
Interview Questions: gpa requirements is like 3.0

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: I was not interviewed for this position, but directly offered after looking at my resume and talking to my references.  However, this was unusual, as most of the times post-docs are interviewed at least over the phone.
Interview Questions: This does not apply to me.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: It took a while to hear from the search committee but once I did I was interviewed within the week and a few days later I was called for a second interview. That interview was a few days alter and it went well. Jobs that have a search committees take longer.
Interview Questions: All the questions I was asked were ones I expected.

title: Intramural Official Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, not hard questions asked just go in knowing something about intramural activities and be personable. They will ask about exoerience but it is ok if you have none because there is trainings available to attend.
Interview Questions: When can you start

title: Media Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward. Group of several employees plus HR person. They were following a script so that all applicants were asked same questions. Many job listings are not real. They often have the future hire already working as a temp. For legal reasons, they need to interview 3 candidates, but position may not truly be open.
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult.

title: Parent Programs Office Student Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The job was posted on the virtual job board with a list of the following duties and requirements that the job would feature. The first step was the email the department with interest, a resume was optional- however, they preferred to receive one. The listing on the website preferred a Freshman or Sophomore in their undergraduate studies. After about a week after the email, I received a phone call for an immediate interview. The process was a basic behavioral interview and was concise.
Interview Questions: How would you describe yourself?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: I was given an small project before the offer was made. The project was related to the research I gonna do when I joined the lab. The professor made the offer after I delivered the results.
Interview Questions: The professor gave me a programming project and expected me to complete within a week. He also had me to complete a literature review and make a powerpoint presentation on the research topic I will begin with in his lab.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied for consultant position through the website during summer break. I immediately got an interview request from IBC right after school started. There were two rounds of interviews. I took two weeks for two rounds of interview to process. First round is behavioral and second round is case interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me one time that you have to think of something creative to deal with something

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral. Essentially they just wanted to make sure you wouldn't steal anything and that you would not be rude to anyone who asks for help at the desk. You sat down with one of the supervisors and she has your application and essentially, if you get the interview, you will be hired.
Interview Questions: What is your class schedule like?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions:
High GPA, especially in the coursework of your major. 
Good recommendation letters from at least three professors.
Good research experiments recommended.
Interview Questions: no unexpected questions. Bring your resume to professors. Read their papers beforehand.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by one person, the supervisor the position would work under. He was cordial, asked me about 6-8 questions. There were no gotcha questions, like, "tell me about one of your weaknesses." They were all fair questions and the atmosphere was relaxed professional. I would prepare with basic interview questions, be prepared to talk about the specifics of a position on your resume (have it on hand), and be as calm as possible.
Interview Questions: Q: How do you handle conflict?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: it was a three hour long interview with a couple back to back sessions with different individuals from the management, presentation for the whole office, and an interview conducted by a committee
Interview Questions:
what skills could  you offer to this position
Describe what you did in your previous job
multitask experience

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Just took 1 hour techincal interview
Interview Questions: Reverse a string recursively

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Interview Descriptions: The Professor that I am going to work with call me. Ask questions about the previous research experience. He introduced his lab and his research, and told me what kind of postdoc he is looking for. The interview goes smoothly. Basically, he did most of the talking. At the end, I asked a few questions related to his work.
Interview Questions: No difficult question

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Sent online application. This was followed by skype interview and on site visit. I gave a presentation on my past research. The lab members asked some questions which were not too difficult for me to answer. I got the impression that they were looking for somebody who could gel into their team as you to have to long hours with each other.
Interview Questions: Describe your past research ? How can you contribute to our work ?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: The professors or a group representatives from the department come to together to do a short talk regarding what each group is about. The prospective student then decides which groups are most interesting and proceeds to the professor's office or lab in a rotation format. Typically for each rotation there maybe 2-5 prospecs there. At each rotation the professors or post-doc asks and answers specific questions regarding the work that is done in the group.
Interview Questions: What type of research do you want to do?

title: Research Assistant 50% Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is basically going through professor's office or schedule meeting with professor that you have interest in their research. Most of the time professors are hard to get in touch so going door by door will be the best bet for most people.

Next you get a call/e-mail from the department if you are admitted to the program and a few weeks later you hear back on the funding situation you will receive. title: Engineering IT Student Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions:
a. I applied using an online hiring system.
b. Most of the communication was via e-mail.
c. After considering my resume, I was asked to interview.
d. The first interview was a social/behavioral interview. I was asked about my skills and strengths, but it was fairly general. I think being polite and friendly is what mattered here the most, and you had to show that you were capable of being professional and fitting in.
e. The second interview was a lot tougher. It was about my ability to handle hardware-related problems thrown at me. I think there idea was to try and crack me. But I kept trying and the interview actually lasted till I finally gave up. I guess they liked how I approached the situation, because I got hired.
Interview Questions: What does UDP stand for? How is it different from what we use commonly today?

This interview lasted 2-3 hours - I first met with the Interim Assistant Dean, and had a brief 1:1 interview.  I then had a panel interview, and my panel consisted of this same person, as well as 4 others.  I then met again with the Interim Asst. Dean, and then the retiring Assistant Dean.  They followed up with my references a week or so later, and then I had to contact them about a month after my interview and was called back later with an offer.

title: Web Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions:
1) Email acknowledging---with somewhat vague and very dry language---that you "are to be considered" by the department for the position you applied and will be contacted.
2) Five part in-person interview that lasts a total of three and a half hours:
  a) Half-hour with your would-be supervisor.
  b) Half-hour with HR.
  c) Half-hour with admin person, or the departmental head.
  d) An hour with panel that consists of the entire IT department that was present that day---in my case 20+ people.
  e) One hour with the search committee.

This process can be daunting but it gives you plenty of time to get to know who you will be working with and find out as much information as possible. The critical part is the meeting with the search committee where they give you a couple of technical questions.

3) If they decide to higher you, you will first be contacted by the person in the unit designated for hiring, which may be someone that you have not met or been in contact with at all. They will set a time to talk with you. This is when they will ask you if you are interested still and where the negotiation process starts---be prepared.
4) They will send you and offer letter stating the terms discussed and a deadline to accept or decline.
5) If you accept the offer will be contingent on you passing a background check and potentially other test(s) depending on the position. For this position only the background check was necessary.
Interview Questions:
- What will show up on the browser for this HTML/CSS/JS code?
-How would you fetch an external JSON API? What library would you use?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Urbana, IL)
Interview Descriptions:
It took 2 months for me to get an interview. The interview process and questions were easy. This is good and bad. It's good if you're not good at interviews, but know what you're doing. Then for a tech position, it should be easy to answer the questions, which they seem to care about more than the behavioral ones. It's bad because they could end up hiring someone incompetent.

You interview with a committee. Typically, a third of the members will know specifics about your position. The rest will be from other departments/positions on campus. Usually after the position closes, they will review all applications and decide to interview the top 3-5 candidates. The committee has a list of pre-defined questions that they'll ask every candidate.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? What is one advantage and one disadvantage for using tables in HTML?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straightforward.  After applying for job online (jobs.illinos.edu), the search committee invites for you for an interview.  The committee consists of selected 4-6 faculty from within that department as well as an HR representative. You will be asked to present a mini lecture generally on a topic related to the courses they are hiring for.  The search committee members all have behavioral questions prepared mainly to assess your personality and how you will fit in with the department.   The search committee is generally composed of random faculty who may not even specialize in they area they are hiring for.  The key advice is to be amicable and professional.  It would be a good idea to search online for the typical questions they ask for teaching positions.  Practice your mock lecture.  If you are truly passionate about teaching and have plans to change things, be careful on how much you share during the interview as this my rub some folks (especially if they are not as passionate about teaching) the wrong way.  Overall, realize that  even if you are hired it is highly likely that you will not interact with any of the committee members  so make sure to put your best foot forward and avoid anything controversial.  Make sure you contemplate about your teaching philosophy.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching philosophy?

title: International Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Champaign, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was relatively straightforward. Someone called me to set up the interview, which they said would be a phone interview. Although I asked about the format, they were extremely vague and never mentioned who would be interviewing me (although I probably should have asked). I guessed this would be a screening of sorts, so I wasn't too worried about it. I was very wrong, as it ended up being a full interview panel of 5 people interviewing me. This completely threw me off, as at that point I'd never had any interview by phone that wasn't a casual get-to-know-you. As such, I was so flustered that even though I was a good candidate for the job, the interview went south very quickly as I was unable to recover from the shock that I had an entire panel of 5 people interviewing me without warning...via phone. Live and learn!
